Verify your nameservers.  Plug them in one at a time and do host av.com   or   host yahoo.com  or  host google.com  and verify that each one is resolving domain names.
See how fast they resolve a domain name for you.  One may be responding very slow.  The fastest one should be first in the list.
Try using the router's IP address.  (Most routers have caching name server enabled, and if it is not, enable it, and use it for  primary nameserver.)
i get the problems when i use the autodetected dns, when i use the one i told you i am fine
yes, it is when i use 192.168.1.1 as nameserver for dns that i cant connect to xchat, pidgin or synaptic repositories
If one of the nameservers is slow or un-reliable, report it to your ISP and ask for an alternative.
See that the router's caching nameserver is turned on.  And that it has the fastest, most reliable nameserver at top of it's list.)
If  you find that one of the suggested nameserver's is not working or not performing well, report it to your ISP.
